intro: Grewia orbifolia, commonly known as the globe thorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its round, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the summer months. Grewia orbifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
